Nigeria's Senate President, Ahmad Lawan and the Speaker of the House of Representatives, Femi Gbajabiamila were paid in dollars (millions of naira) to ensure the passage of the controversial Petroleum Industry Bill (PIB) recently signed into law by President Muhammadu Buhari, SaharaReporters has learnt.
"Lawan was paid $2 million (N823 million) while Gbajabiamila was paid $1.5 million (N617 million) as bribes," the source said.
The Nigerian Senate recently passed the Petroleum Industry Bill approving 3 per cent for host communities despite calls from various quarters that the provisions made for host communities should be reviewed upward.
Their president, Benjamin Tamanarebi said the PIB passed by NASS was a fruitless exercise and unacceptable to the host communities.
In their July 5 meeting, governors of Nigeria’s southern states also rejected the proposed three per cent share to host communities in the Petroleum Industry Bill.

headline: World Bank applauds Obaseki’s deployment of tech to strengthen basic education, boost skills devt – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBENIN CITY – The World Bank has praised Edo State Governor, Mr. Godwin Obaseki for the deployment of technological innovations to drive reforms in basic education and skills development in the state.
World Bank’s Senior Education and Technology Policy Specialist and Global Lead for Technology and Innovation in Education, Mr. Robert Hawkins, at a MasterCard sponsored programme, ED Tech, commended Governor Obaseki for bringing together stakeholders in the public and private sector to deliver major reforms in basic education and skills development in Edo State.
According to him, effective leadership is necessary for constructive public-private partnerships that can take advantage of the knowledge that those in the private sector have and use it to meet the needs of the public sector.
In April 2018, the Obaseki-led administration implemented far-reaching reforms in the basic education sector, deploying technology-based modern methods of teacher training, lessons delivery, pupils’ evaluation and classroom management through the Edo Basic Education Sector Transformation (EdoBEST) programme.
The governor has now expanded the EdoBEST programme to capture secondary schools and tertiary institutions in the state.

headline: COVID-19: Edo records 171 cases, three deaths in third wave – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:

Obi said the 22 new cases, raised the total number of confirmed cases in the state to 171, noting that Edo also recorded two more recoveries from the virus and collected 174 samples for testing.
He stated that over 95 percent of the newly confirmed cases are those who were never vaccinated, adding, “This is a clear indication that the vaccines provide significant protection against the virus.
Obi, however, charged residents not to disregard the state’s preventive protocols against the spread of the deadly virus to avoid infection.

headline: In Kaduna, bandit groups turn against each other, kill nine
summarized_story:
Nemesis caught up with two groups of armed bandits in Giwa local government of Kaduna state who in a fratricidal gun duel killed nine of their fellow bandits on Wednesday.

“Credible human intelligence networks informed the Kaduna state government of the development, which was further corroborated by security agencies.

Nigeria wins 4x400m mixed relay gold at World Athletics U20 -NigPilot
summarized_story:
Team Nigeria lived up to pre-race billings as the 4x400m mixed relay team won the gold medal in a new Championship record time of 3:19.70.
The quartet of Johnson Nnamani, Imaobong Nse Uko, Opeyemi Oke, and Bamidele Ajayi also made history as the first winners of the event at the World U20 Championship , beating Poland (3:19.80) and India (3:20.60).
Nse Uko has also qualified for the individual 400 m final scheduled for Saturday and stands as the favorite to restore Nigeria as World U20 champions since Bisi Afolabi succeeded Fatimah Yusuf as queen of the quarter-mile in 1994 in Lisbon, Portugal.
In the men’s javelin throw, Team Nigeria’s Chinecherem Nnamdi throw a massive new personal best and Nigeria U20 record of 78.03 to qualify for the final.
The 19-year-old 2019 African Games bronze medal winner added almost 5 cm to his previous best of 73.24 m to jump to the queue as one of the favorites for the gold medal.

headline: Bandits Attack Rini Town In Zamfara, Abduct Many Locals
summarized_story:
Bandits have attacked Rini town in Bakura Local Government Area (LGA) of Zamfara State.
Eyewitnesses told Channels Television on Friday that the armed men stormed the town at about 2:30am and started shooting sporadically.
While residents were said to have refused to come out of their homes despite heavy gunshots renting the air, the bandits abducted many locals numbering over 60.

headline: Fayemi: We Don’t Believe the Subsidy Numbers, It’s a Fiddling of Figures in NNPC
summarized_story:
Chairman of the Nigerian Governors’ Forum, Kayode Fayemi, has spoken on behalf of his colleagues in reaction to the new Petroleum Industry Act signed by President Muhammadu Buhari on Monday.
Fayemi who spoke exclusively to ARISE News on Thursday expressed reservations on aspects of the bill.
Here he reiterates the governors’ stand on subsidy.
